io.divide.otto

Class EventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.divide.otto.EventHandler

  • public class EventHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Wraps a single-argument 'handler' method on a specific object.

    This class only verifies the suitability of the method and event type if something fails. Callers are expected t verify their uses of this class.

    Two EventHandlers are equivalent when they refer to the same method on the same object (not class). This property is used to ensure that no handler method is registered more than once.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        If invalidated, will subsequently refuse to handle events. Should be called when the wrapped object is unregistered from the Bus.

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(java.lang.Object event)
                 throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invokes the wrapped handler method to handle event.
        Parameters:
        event - event to handle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if previously invalidated.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the wrapped method throws any Throwable that is not an Error (Errors are propagated as-is).
